description: {"blocks":[{"key":"21dri","text":"Sterilization and post-hatch care of gnotobiotic Periplaneta americana, as adapted from Doll et. al. (see below)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":49,"length":21,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"78u2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf9g1","text":"Doll J, Trexler P, Reynolds L, Bernard G. 1963. The use of peracetic acid to obtain germfree invertebrate eggs for gnotobiotic studies. Am Midl Nat 69:231-239","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"ask6i","text":"Laminar flow hood","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eo3s9","text":"5-mL eppendorf microcentrifuge tubes (4 per 3~5 egg cases)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f18ft","text":"0.1% SDS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"728vd","text":"0.1% peracetic acid","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"86gsp","text":"4-5 pairs of sterile forceps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c9vu0","text":"1.5-mL eppendorf microcentrifuge tubes (2 per egg case)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"23rdt","text":"Sterile water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fnd1","text":"LB agar slants (10g tryptone, 5g yeast extract, 10g NaCl, 20g agar; in 1000 mL water)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2iics","text":"Secondary container (large enough to fit LB agar slants; we use plastic bug cages), sterilized (via bleach/ethanol/UV/autoclaving) -- I just do bleach + ethanol + UV (20 min), since our containers are not autoclavable","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
status_info:
Reliable so far in producing cockroaches that live on LB agar with no visible growth!
Might tweak the medium if nymphal development appears stunted.

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"29i2v","text":"Pulling egg cases directly off females' abdomens ensures the eggs have not been sitting in the litter a long time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5karr","text":"This also typically results in \"cleaner\" oothecae, with less excrement on the outside","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"DBDFF9B0C33211E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669096,"previous_id":null,"previous_guid":null,"section":"Collect oothecae egg cases) from colony"}
steps.section: Collect oothecae egg cases) from colony

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"e5707","text":"This can be done using kimwipes and water or SDS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7EB50840C5A111E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669891,"previous_guid":"DBDFF9B0C33211E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Physically clean any visible\/major excrement off of the outside of the oothecae"}
steps.section: Physically clean any visible/major excrement off of the outside of the oothecae

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"5daos","text":"Place 3-5 egg cases in a 5-mL eppendorf with 1~2 mL 0.1% SDS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"3rrfs","text":"Vortex to wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9q6qn","text":"Transfer egg cases to new 5-mL tube and repeat above steps","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"DBF069E0C5A211E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669892,"previous_guid":"7EB50840C5A111E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Wash oothecae in 0.1% SDS"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"au4m1","text":"Transfer to new 5-mL eppendorf with 2~3 mL sterile water","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ct645","text":"Vortex to rinse","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fv2r8","text":"Transfer egg cases to new 5-mL tube and repeat above steps until there are no more suds","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"6770FFC0C5A311E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669893,"previous_guid":"DBF069E0C5A211E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Rinse oothecae"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d95qs","text":"*This must be done shortly prior to sterilization because the acid will become ineffective for sterilization when it breaks down into hydrogen peroxide and acetate*","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"31oi1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"13kgv","text":"Our peracetic acid comes as a 32% stock solution (stabile in the fridge)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4feb5","text":"0.1% peracetic acid = (10 uL stock) + (3.2 mL sterile water) ------ this is enough for up to 5 oothecae","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"audgl","text":"Depending on how many eggs are being sterilized, this can be made in a 5-mL eppendorf, or a 15-mL conical tube for larger batches","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"A5DC9D00C5A311E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669894,"previous_guid":"6770FFC0C5A311E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Preparation of 0.1% peracetic acid for sterilization"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d42f","text":"Place washed\/rinsed oothecae in 0.1% peracetic acid for 5 min, invert occasionally to ensure total surface sterilization.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"2bgrd","text":"At this point, transfer all materials to sterilized laminar flow hood, to prevent post-sterilization contamination.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"B12E9A90C5A411E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669895,"previous_guid":"A5DC9D00C5A311E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Sterilize oothecae"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5eld3","text":"Using sterile (pre-autoclaved) forceps, pull out individual egg cases from acid bath, place each case in its own 1 mL of pre-aliquoted sterile water (in 1.5-mL eppendorf tubes), invert numerous times to rinse. (in laminar flow hood)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"7p6sh","text":"Transfer oothecae to new sterile water tubes for an additional rinse. (in laminar flow hood)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"FDC2A360C5A411E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669896,"previous_guid":"B12E9A90C5A411E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Rinse oothecae (post-sterilization)"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ocn8","text":"Using a new set of sterile forceps (different from those that retrieved the egg cases from the acid bath), transfer oothecae from rinse tubes to sterile LB agar slants (in laminar flow hood). Place slants in secondary container; this can now be removed from the laminar flow hood,","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ch32e","text":"Incubate entire containment system at 30 C; oothecae should begin hatching ~4 weeks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"fp504","text":"Check LB slants for microbial growth (especially in the first few days); remove and discard tubes with growth.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"7219CF90C5A511E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669897,"previous_guid":"FDC2A360C5A411E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Incubate eggs @ 30 C until hatching"}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eqdbs","text":"Newborns will eat LB agar, excreting it in small, translucent beads.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"qedm","text":"These young (nymphal) stages of the cockroach can be prone to dehydration; water by pipetting < 1 mL sterile water onto the agar while in laminar flow hood. Do this once a week.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9k089","text":"Continue watching for unwanted growth on the agar.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4sk7d","text":"Transfer nymphs to an Erlenmeyer flask (with LB agar at the bottom), when space becomes tight. This should also be done in a laminar flow hood. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[],"guid":"E6AFB270C5A511E8A11471F95458DD4E","id":669898,"previous_guid":"7219CF90C5A511E8A11471F95458DD4E","section":"Post-hatch care"}
